label: A3B12C_hP32_194_af_2k_c-001
title: Hexagonal $\alpha$-Ca$_{2}$SiO$_{4}$ Structure
comments:
Ca$_{2}$SiO$_{4}$ exists in a variety of structures (Mumme, 1996; Yamnova, 2011): \begin{itemize} \item hexagonal $\alpha$-Ca$_{2}$SiO$_{4}$, stable above $1445^{\circ}$C.  There is some dispute as to whether this occurs in a \begin{itemize} \item \href{current_web_home_dir/A2B4C_hP14_164_abd_di_d-001}{trigonal, space group $P\overline{3}m1$ \#164} structure or a \item \href{current_web_home_dir/A3B12C_hP32_194_af_2k_c-001}{disordered hexagonal, space group $P6_{3}/mmc$ \#194} structure, as shown here. \end{itemize} \item \href{current_web_home_dir/A4B8C_oP52_62_2d_4d_c-001}{orthorhombic $\alpha_{H}$'-Ca$_{2}$SiO$_{4}$}, stable in the range $1160-1425^{\circ}$C, \item \href{current_web_home_dir/A2B4C_oP84_33_6a_12a_3a-001}{orthorhombic $\alpha_{L}$'-Ca$_{2}$SiO$_{4}$}, stable in the range $690-1160^{\circ}$C, \item \href{current_web_home_dir/A2B4C_mP28_14_2e_4e_e-001}{monoclinic $\beta$-Ca$_{2}$SiO$_{4}$}, stable in the range $500-690^{\circ}$C and found in nature as the metastable mineral larnite, and \item $\gamma$-Ca$_{2}$SiO$_{4}$, stable below $500^{\circ}$C, in the \href{current_web_home_dir/A2B4C_oP28_62_ac_2cd_c-001}{olivine ($S1_{2}$) structure}. \end{itemize} ~ \vspace{-.25in} 
 There is considerable disorder in this structure: the Ca-II (4f) site is half-filled, and both the oxygen sites are 1/3 filled.  Presumably this means that four oxygen atoms surround each silicon atom.
